question: Which muscle inserts on the lesser tubercle of the humerus?
short_explanation: Subscapularis inserts on the lesser tubercle.
long_explanation: The lesser tubercle of the humerus serves as the insertion point for the subscapularis muscle, one of the four rotator cuff muscles.
applied_example: Pain near the lesser tubercle may indicate subscapularis tendinopathy or strain.
text: Which muscle inserts on the lesser tubercle of the humerus?

question: The lesser tubercle is located on which aspect of the humerus?
short_explanation: It lies on the anterior surface of the humerus.
long_explanation: The lesser tubercle is a small projection on the anterior aspect of the humerus, allowing the subscapularis to contribute to internal rotation.
applied_example: Therapists palpate the anterior humerus to evaluate subscapularis tendon issues.
text: The lesser tubercle is located on which aspect of the humerus?

question: Which movement is primarily affected by damage to the lesser tubercle insertion site?
long_explanation: As the subscapularis inserts on the lesser tubercle, injury at this site compromises internal rotation of the humerus.
applied_example: Massage therapy for frozen shoulder often targets the subscapularis to restore internal rotation.
text: Which movement is primarily affected by damage to the lesser tubercle insertion site?

question: Which rotator cuff muscle is *not* attached to the greater tubercle?
short_explanation: Only subscapularis attaches to the lesser tubercle.
long_explanation: Three rotator cuff muscles insert on the greater tubercle, but the subscapularis alone inserts on the lesser tubercle.
applied_example: Knowing this distinction helps isolate muscle dysfunction in rotator cuff pathologies.
text: Which rotator cuff muscle is *not* attached to the greater tubercle?

question: What clinical sign may result from subscapularis tendon injury at the lesser tubercle?
long_explanation: Subscapularis damage can impair internal rotation and cause anterior shoulder pain, especially at the lesser tubercle insertion.
applied_example: Therapists assess internal rotation strength to detect subscapularis issues.
text: What clinical sign may result from subscapularis tendon injury at the lesser tubercle?

question: Which test isolates subscapularis function and may stress the lesser tubercle?
short_explanation: The lift-off test assesses subscapularis function.
long_explanation: The lift-off test requires placing the dorsum of the hand on the lower back and lifting away, activating subscapularis which inserts on the lesser tubercle.
applied_example: Limited lift-off may suggest tendinopathy at the lesser tubercle.
text: Which test isolates subscapularis function and may stress the lesser tubercle?

question: Which movement should be avoided during acute inflammation of the lesser tubercle tendon attachment?
short_explanation: Internal rotation stresses the subscapularis tendon.
long_explanation: Internal rotation directly activates subscapularis, stressing its tendon at the lesser tubercle; avoiding this motion helps healing in acute phases.
applied_example: Massage and therapeutic modalities focus on reducing inflammation before reintroducing rotation.
text: Which movement should be avoided during acute inflammation of the lesser tubercle tendon attachment?

question: The tendon of which muscle passes near but does *not* insert on the lesser tubercle?
short_explanation: The long head of the biceps passes in the intertubercular groove.
long_explanation: Although the long head of the biceps tendon lies in the groove between the greater and lesser tubercles, it inserts on the supraglenoid tubercle — not on the lesser tubercle.
applied_example: Understanding these relationships aids in treating anterior shoulder pain with multiple muscle contributors.
text: The tendon of which muscle passes near but does *not* insert on the lesser tubercle?

question: Massage therapy to which muscle can reduce stress at the lesser tubercle?
short_explanation: Subscapularis inserts on the lesser tubercle.
long_explanation: Treating the subscapularis helps release tension at its insertion on the lesser tubercle, reducing strain on the anterior shoulder.
applied_example: Deep massage and trigger point therapy inside the axilla target this muscle effectively.
text: Massage therapy to which muscle can reduce stress at the lesser tubercle?

question: Which fascia or ligament covers the intertubercular groove adjacent to the lesser tubercle?
short_explanation: The transverse humeral ligament spans the groove.
long_explanation: The transverse humeral ligament holds the long head of the biceps tendon in the intertubercular groove between the greater and lesser tubercles.
applied_example: Tearing this ligament can cause biceps tendon subluxation and shoulder pain.
text: Which fascia or ligament covers the intertubercular groove adjacent to the lesser tubercle?
